answerText: velocity [or speed; or group velocity; or group speed][10] This quantity through a fluid is equal to the square root of the bulk modulus divided by the density. The ratio of objects' speeds to this quantity is called the Mach number.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2015 | Maryland A + Minnesota  | 1 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These devices that measure fluid flow velocity are useful for measuring an aircraft's Mach number. They use the static pressure of their internal fluids and measure the stagnation pressure in order to determine velocity. [10] Name this quantity, whose "group" type is equal to the partial derivative of the angular frequency with respect to the wavenumber and describes wave envelopes.
